intro: Peponium rectipilosum, commonly known as the hairy pumpkin, is a species of flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, lobed leaves and distinctive, hairy stems. Its fruit, which resembles a pumpkin, is typically orange in color and can grow to be quite sizable. Peponium rectipilosum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
